website_summaries.verdict: A compact and convenient machine – if you are in the market for a canister vacuum, you won't be disappointed with this model.
pros: Lightweight and easy to manipulate for mobile cleaning
Has carpet and hard floor cleaning capabilities and telescopic cleaning want
Indicator light notifies when bag is full
cons: The bags are a bit awkward to change, and the suction power is stronger on hard floors compared to carpet

website_summaries.verdict: This vacuum locks dirt up tight and is flexible enough for use on furniture, stairs, and floors.
pros: Telescoping wand included to help you reach high places
Variable suction control using the buttons on the handle
Four bags included with your purchase
Powerful machine with a small footprint
cons: This vacuum may struggle a little on shag rugs or thicker carpets

customer_reviews.title: Useless x 2
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought two of these useless vacuum cleaners.. I thought the fact that the first one broke quickly was a mere fluke, but the second one broke immediately after we received it. It’s upsetting that machines are built this poorly and only end up creating bigger garbage dumps and wasting the earth’s (and the unsuspecting buyer’s) resources.
customer_reviews.author: Webraven

customer_reviews.title: Great Vaccum
customer_reviews.text: great Vaccum, does a very good Job. I vacuumed now all kinds of floor with it: wood, Laminate, tile, diffrent carpet types sucction is awesome, get's the dirt gone. cable retracts quick, the sucction control works great. it has a total of 3 wheels on the bottom - 2 in the back and 1 swirl arround wheel in the front area, so it is very easy to maneuver Yes you have to exchange the bags, but it is very easy to do. I'm very happy with my new stylish purple vaccum for that bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: Worldofdreams

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on carpet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my old vacuum died--the reviews looked promising, but when I tried it on my carpet (just normal not shag carpet), it was very hard to move across the carpet. I ended up returning it (even though there was a return fee). Avoid this one for carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Skip over this vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend against this product, not ergonomically sound, cumbersome, the power doesn't suck enough to pull up anything. The front part of the sucker attachment doesn't glide along the carpet very easily. Its more of a chore just to make the vacuum work than it is to actually use it. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSexy

customer_reviews.title: From the department of 'You get what you pay for'.
customer_reviews.text: Major design defect. The head (the bit that goes on the floor) keeps falling off the tube. It is connected purely by force without any kind of holding button or fastener. I called Bissell and end result of conversatiin was, 'Sorry about that'.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tilbury

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used it 3 times now, all hardwood floors, small apartment. Great suction, easy to use. Got all that dust in the window seals. All the dog hair (3 dogs). It is really great & compact, glad I took a chance on it. Lays flat for under sofa, entertain and dresser areas. Metal piece is a good 3ft tube is maybe another 3ft.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst vacuum cleaner I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst vacuum cleaner I have ever owned. The sucking power is minimal, the bag is not full enough and it stops taking anything, it takes 10 times longer to vacuum my apartment compared to Oreck (last vacuum cleaner I had for years). Even though it costs less, the money and your effort is not worth it. I gave it two months trying it - I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Light Vacuum But . . .
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer said, you can't use it if you are very tall. I'm a little over 5'6" and while I'm not leaning over when I vacuum, my 5'11" husband says he does have to lean forward a bit because the tube is not long enough when he is standing up straight. I have had the vacuum for about 5 months and it's working just fine. Small and easy to store and use in cramped city apartments. I would not recommend it for wall-to-wall carpets if you have pets; the vacuum is fine on our our kilms, but not great for picking up cat hair on a high-pile wool rug.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Lap Swimmer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in January. It does a wonderful job of cleaning my floors and getting in the hard to reach places. I'm familiar with a LOT of vacuum cleaners as my grandfather is a vacuum cleaner repair man for over sixty years. You cannot beat the price of this vacuum and the quality! I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: megan ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little machine
customer_reviews.text: This little wonder is a great addition for my cleaning. I bought the extra attachments for it too, (Universal Vacuum Attachments Accessories Cleaning Kit Brush Nozzle Crevice Tool for 1 1/4 inch& 1 3/8 inch Standard Hose 6pcs) because it came with some little thing that would get lost, because it is so small. Can't wait to clean my car too. I have used it on bare floors, dusting walls (log walls) and ready to tackle dusting the rest of the house.....I have a wood furnace, and a small wood stove...so much ash floats around house....great cleaning when something works. I also own another vacuum with a power beater head for rugs....not a rug machine......
customer_reviews.author: C. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: The best vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely my favorite and the best vacuum ever!! Most of the vacuums that are available in the USA are these bag-less, unwieldy machines. This vacuum on the other hand is perfect! It's super light, has a long cord, has a strong suction and is so easy to use! Due to its shape, it is very easy to clean under cabinets, couch, table and other rather difficult to reach areas! The vacuum works better when using on the wood floor (clear surfaces) rather than floors with installed carpets. I would absolutely recommend this vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Use rubber bands to keep the attachments from falling off
customer_reviews.text: This is a great vaccum for the price. It's powerful and lightweight. The only thing that kills it is the stupid attachment that keeeeeeps falling out no matter how I stuff it in. So much frustration with otherwise great vacuuming! My solution - rubber bands. Go round the top of the hose and push the attachment in as far as possible. It hasn't fallen out since. Only thing is, I'm very unwilling to change attachments now that it's on so tight, which is fine since I bought it for my floors anyway
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VACUUM
customer_reviews.text: This Vac has a bag.....I have a hoover upright also.... I cant stand playing in the dirt of a bagless VAC.....so much work washing componets.....with the ZING just toss the bag....no need for cleaning only but rinsing 2 filters.....so much easier and light weight to move around...The zing has adjustable suction which is really nice to dial down on area rugs.....because it has alot of suction....I LOVE IT.....Retractable cord...excellent for someone who vacuums from a chair...
customer_reviews.author: TIMEOUT

customer_reviews.title: Nice Litte Vaccuum
customer_reviews.text: This is of course a lot of work, no fancy motorized roller, etc. I work up a sweat using it in my tiny flat. That said, I bought it because it is nearly impossible to find one with bags anymore, and I have serious allergy problems which require bags. It has very strong suction and if treated gently should last for an acceptable time. I use it on hard floor and carpet, it works better than my previous "removable dirt canister" model which cost more and did less picking up of dirt. Good value for small areas, I would not want to use it if I had a large house or large carpets.
customer_reviews.author: keileidh

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve bought this sooner
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic upgrade from cordless rechargeable stick and shark canisters. I have no pets but this thing has cleaned up dirt and debris that my Shark Canister vaccine left behind in my carpet. The adjustable dial suction is super convenient to use for hard flooring and sofas. This baby will suck impressively. And if you’re a dead bug hater like me, I cannot stress enough how reassuring it is to have the extendible hose and enclosed bag to limit the amount of time and proximity you spend near the icky insect. It can be loud but it is lightweight and makes it easy to move quickly. I love my first grown up vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian A. Wells

customer_reviews.title: It's great till it breaks.
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum. It's almost a year old, but the hose just fell apart. I'll have buy another vacuum. The hose is one half the price of a New vacuum. I hope this third one will last for more then 11 months. The motor is great just the pieces don't last. The poor thing only works for one year and six months of you are lucky. Bissell use to stand by their vacuums. But now you have to buy new ones. I had a Kirby for thirty years. I love this vacuum Bissell made i just do not like buying so many of them.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M. Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great little work horse!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sturdy vacuum with variable suction for small jobs and the ZING turned out to be a great little work horse with 10 amps. PROS: Strong suction with a dial for quick/easy adjustment of suction strength. CONS: The hose needs to be two feet longer. The nozzle needs to be straight... not curved... and something needs to stablize the body while pulling it behind you... as it likes to roll around like an over-sized Easter egg resting mostly on its side when attempting to pull it around the house. So it usually gets carried to avoid over stressing the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Cherrise

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum ever!
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum, great price! Plenty of power! I've been using this for over 2 years and it still works great. It gets a lot of abuse around here, and recently the wheels on the floor part got broken off... So I bought a fancy new expensive vacuum for Christmas but it was terrible compared to this thing! I am now still using this to keep my house clean while the shiny new one stands in the corner in shame LOL. I will buy another one of these as soon as I can justify buying myself another new vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Blu

customer_reviews.title: This is a rug that I could easily vacuum with my old canister vac
customer_reviews.text: I returned this vacuum today, the day it arrived. The floor nozzle kept coming off even after attaching it on as hard as I could. It does not click on, just friction is expected to hold it. Also, a device that should hold on one of the two attachments kept coming off of the metal wand. I found no way to store the second attachment. Finally, when I switched the setting to clean a rug, it's suction was so strong that I could not vacuum the area rug. This is a rug that I could easily vacuum with my old canister vac. I refuse to put up with this nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: Popadia Joan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the many features of this Vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit concerned when I turned this vacuum on and was trying to clean my rugs because the suction was powerful that I couldn't move the vacuum across the rugs with ease, but then I noticed that there was a knob that could adjust the suction power... SO COOL! I love that there is a function for adjusting suction power. I also really appreciate the retractable power cord, and the ability to change the vacuum head. They really put in so many features for a compact vacuum. Works great for what I need! I just wish they had made this in different colors... that would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: K. C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little vac that you can carry around
customer_reviews.text: This vac has more suction that I expected. It is light weight and makes a great little vac to clean up with for small clean up. I don't know that I would use this vac as my primary unless I had a small apartment or home. My only concern is that the bags appear to be made of paper. I am thinking if you don't keep an eye on how full the bag gets, it could burst and blow dust everywhere. I don't know if it would, it was just something I thought about when I compared the bag to the bags I use in my primary canister vac (that is too heavy to carry around).
customer_reviews.author: CCL5

customer_reviews.title: Great suction.  Light weight
customer_reviews.text: Nice little vacuum. Easy to carry around. Very good suction. We'll see how it is in a year, but right now, it's great. Good for tile and smooth floors. Not really designed for carpeting of any kind. Had a little Shark bagless for 10 years and finally had to toss it. This Bissell is lighter. Cord is long enough for what I need and the extendable shaft works fine and is a normal length. If people say they have to bend over to use this machine probably don't know how to extend the wand. Not much for attachments, but I have a pile of them from other vacuums over the years that fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: attachments that come with it don't work well at all
customer_reviews.text: At first i was ready to send this vacuum back, but I realized it was not the vacuum cleaner itself, but the attachments that i hated. then i found some old ones that fit well and so i kept it. these old attachments work great. the ones that came with it are very poor at doing anything. So, with the old attachments from some previous vacuum cleaner, it works very nicely and is small and lightweight enough to carry upstairs. Bags are easy to change.
customer_reviews.author: dorine emery

customer_reviews.title: Smells
customer_reviews.text: Although it has a bad off gassing odor it is surprisingly adequate. My carpet is not real carpet in that it is the cheapest they could install. It is like a bare floor so this vacuum does the job. I have bought 2 Shark vacs and both were destroyed by the backing of the floor and it was a mess emptying the dust container. I was shocked by the attachments. They are so small I can fit them in my jeans pocket. I was again surprised at how they were more than adequate. I gave it 3 stars because of the odor. Any product made with black seems to have this issue. I try to stay away from them.
customer_reviews.author: SanScram

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved into a smaller house and thought the zing would be perfect. There is just a small area with carpet, and the rest is hardwood flooring. Easy to switch between carpet and flooring. The suction is a lot better than I thought it would be. For a smaller vacuum, it’s got great suction. Better than a shop vac. Only suggestion I have is if you order replacement bags, make sure they are from bissell. I tried to save a buck and the bags were junk. I found a 5 pack and replacement filters a a good price here.
customer_reviews.author: dianna Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Bought to replace my old 9595A, but not as good on carpet
customer_reviews.text: I really love the Bissell 9595A, but it can be a real pain to clean stairs with and carry around so I purchased this vacuum instead. The suction power is not as strong as the 9595A and you can't vacuum back and forth with this vacuum like you can with a traditional canister vacuum on the carpet. It does a very poor job of vacuuming my carpet. After several months of use, I cleaned up the interior of my 9595A and went back to that. Frankly I hate this vacuum, I wish I wouldn't have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Sisko

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for tile/linoleum/hardwood, NOT for carpet
customer_reviews.text: The suction isn't great on this, but it works fine if you're not on carpet. The suction just isn't adequate and the bag has to be semi-folded to fit inside, so it fills almost immediately and clogs. The extension isn't quite long enough for a taller person (I'm 5'11") so I have to hunch over when using it. If you want a cheap vacuum for little messes in the kitchen or bathroom this will be fine, but don't buy this if you want a deep cleaning on carpet or rugs.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Buck

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: My house is mostly mostly hardwood floors but some of the rooms are carpeted. I have no issues vacuuming up either but I would say it works better on hardwood floors because there's no motorized brush. I was happy to see it came with replacement bags, as I wasn't expecting it to! Overall, I think this is a really great value and I'm glad that I didn't spend several hundred dollars on another vacuum. Also, not having to wrap a cord afterwards is a relief. With just a press of a button, the cord shoots back into the vacuum. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for bare floors and dog hair
customer_reviews.text: Having wood floors, I don't need an expensive vacuum, and do need adequate suction to pick up the shedding from two large dogs. This vacuum suits my needs of keeping floors clean and being easy to maneuver and carry. It's not noisy and, at it's lowest setting, picks up the hair and leftovers from bone chewing. Normally my one dog shies away from the more expensive (and noisy) vacuums, but she doesn't care about this vacuum. One negative is the opening to reduce suction on the hose nozzle; it is plastic on plastic, and only by holding your thumb on it can you eliminate the loss of suction. All in all, it's a good buy and I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: NKSR

customer_reviews.title: Good but could use improvement
customer_reviews.text: We just had several rooms of hardwood flooring installed, so did some research on what vacuums would be good for hard floors, and this one seemed to get mentioned a lot. After using it for a while, here are my top three Pros and Cons: PROS: Strong suction Compact and Lightweight Works well on hard floors CONS: Cord is too short Too easy to bump the air regulator valve open Not great for any carpet: drags too much and head keeps coming off
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD O.

customer_reviews.title: A bargain!
customer_reviews.text: You do get what you pay for here! Frustrating to use. Motor unit, seems very decent , little loud, but it is cheap! Power is good, controls good. Everything else really cheaply made, this is a cleaner that needs $50 better tools/ hose to be really good. Basic suction above floor should be ok, though again that hose! Be aware, it is a good deal for the money, but maybe should spend more.
customer_reviews.author: David Roper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for RV
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for our RV and if you buy high "Environmental" quality bags it's as good as a small unit gets. Bagless vacuums simply filter out the larger particles and spew the microscopic stuff back in your living space. A premier consumer testing facility always has bagged units at the top of its ratings, but that also depends on the quality of the bags.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lange

customer_reviews.title: I get a little crazy with the Bissell
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little vacuum! It’s lightweight, powerful and you can decrease the suction if you are tired of sucking up your lightweight door mats 😡 It’s great for all the small jobs and makes cleaning a breeze. I specifically got this for getting under the beds but I use it much more than I thought I would. It makes cleaning fun and It gets all the places the heavy Kirby upright doesn’t. Honestly I have the all Kirby attachments but it’s too much of a hassle to use them. Use the Kirby and use this 😃❤️
customer_reviews.author: Ms Maria

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Pro's 1. Easy to put together and use. 2. Strong suction 3. Great filter. I used it to pick up joint compound dust and Silica powder and didn't notice any kick back in the air. 4. Lightweight. 5. Cord allows me to vacuum a 250 square foot room. 6. No mess filter. It is very easy to change. Con's 1. The dual attachment for crevice and dust is terrible. The dust part always unfolds itself, making it a hassle to use. Would strongly recommend buying a separate attachment for dusting. 2. Can be very tricky to navigate on vertical surfaces. 3. Bag replacement is very expensive. 4. Awkward to use on stairs. I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Q.C

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum cleaner after reading previous reviews and I am also going to give this product a head's up! I count on other reviews when buying things like this -- I know, it's not a major purchase, but still ... Anyway, I have 4 dogs and dog hair everywhere, so I was so happy this little, lightweight cleaner zips around easily and has tremendous suction. With a touch of the floor nozzle, I can tilt the brush up and down, depending on whether I am cleaning rugs or the hardwood floors. Had I known how well this unit works, I would have tossed my clumsy upright ages ago.
customer_reviews.author: babz

customer_reviews.title: great vacume
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and compact the attachments are junk but I knew that from the reviews, the attachments from my Eureka Might mite fit so I am happy......... much more suction power than the mighty mite ......self winding cord is nice too........... buy this vacuum you wont be sorry just be prepared to buy attachments if you dont have an old mighty mite..........my vacuum was a return and I'm sure it was because of the poor attachments the vacuum itself is awesome
customer_reviews.author: E. Money

customer_reviews.title: BE Aware! Defect vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful! This is the worst vacuum I’ve had. It broke down only after 2 or 3 usages. It’s very expensive compared to its performance. When it’s broken down, i contacted the customer service, so they required me to bring to a retail store to get it fixed. Then, made a trip to it, and he required me to pay $20 in advance. Then, he told me that because it’s out of warranty, it’s non refundable, even though it’s only used for 2 or 3 times. I wish I didn’t pay a penny to this cheap company and rude and stingy customer services.
customer_reviews.author: ASA

customer_reviews.title: Great little powerhouse of a vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I love this little vacuum! My home is mostly hard floors, with carpets in the bedrooms. I use this vacuum several times per week to clean my hardwood/tile and area rugs, and even use it on the carpet. It doesn't have a brush roller, but it does a good job nonetheless. The suction is very powerful and has not lost power in the year I've had the vacuum. The bags can hold a lot as well and rarely need changing. And when they do need changed, they're not messy at all like many bagless vacuums can be. I was skeptical that this little machine could do the job, but I've been really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: RLM

customer_reviews.title: well...
customer_reviews.text: My dream is to own a stick vacuum but until I win the lottery, this will have to do! I like being able to vacuum under the furniture to catch the dust buffalo herd that roams there! (I have 3 dogs in a small home) The canister is light enough to drag along or carry. The suction is almost too strong for the type of vacuum head provided. Without a beater bar, vacuuming the rug or furniture is a wrestling match. It is great for my wood and tile floors. NOVEMBER 2018 EDIT-I hate using this vacuum. It's like wrestling an octopus that wants to only eat the rug. Regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: margblick

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this product, the cord is too short had to repeatedly move from outlet to outlet, it was clumsy to use on our area rugs, hardwood floors it was okay. The wand kept coming apart and the cord rewind would not feed all the way into the canister. Used a couple of times, at which point when the cord was feeding back, it left approximately 35 inches outside of unit, totally stuck, would not allow me any more cord to use, returned item this week. Opted for my full credit rather than replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MLK

customer_reviews.title: Compact design great suction!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome vacuum that is compact, good tools and easy to move around. Got this to replace a classic stand up vacuum. This one has a dial for different suctions that comes in handy for area rugs and curtains. You can even carry it easily and do stairs. I like the switch on the bottom for carpet or hard wood floors. Works SO much better for dust than swiffers. Handle is telescoping so you can adjust the height and not have to bend over too far.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Pretty ok with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: It does the job pretty ok but i think for smaller carpets or apartments, uhh one minus detail is that the tubes where you grab the vacuum cleaner are too short so if you are a tall person you are gonna have a real hard time vacuuming your space, im short but still had a hard time vacuuming my small carpets, they need to sell an extension for normal size people, not midgets
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Narvaez

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: We live in Florida and it doesn't take long before you drag so much sand in the house that you have an indoor beach. I purchased this for the wife, who initially asked me why we needed it. Rather than drag our expensive and heavy duty vac out of the closet, we keep this in our utility room. This little guy is so powerful and so light weight, it has become our go-to vac. Have used this several hundred times, so it has proven durability.
customer_reviews.author: ScratchyT Pirate

customer_reviews.title: Good little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Zing. The first one lasted several years before the extending wand fell apart. I’ve had vacuum cleaners five times the cost of this one not last as long. It has very good suction power. I have all hard floor, 2 large dogs and 3 men on a farm...lots of dirt. I did buy a different floor brush that I felt did a better job on my textured vinyl plank. The only thing I don’t like is the cord. Six more feet would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: CLD

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: You shouldn't look a bargain horse in the mouth -- for $50 it probably can't be beat. HOWEVER, it's fairly flawed. The ventilation port is on top so it often blows in my face; the hose is stiff and lacks flexion; the attachments are about useless; the spring that winds the cord is weak. But the suction is excellent and it pretty much does basic floor cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Bic Parker

customer_reviews.title: bissel bussle
customer_reviews.text: I love this little vacuum. It has great suction and is very light. i can vacuum everywhere and never get tired of lugging it around. I have very high ceilings and would love to have and extention wand on it to get the cobwebs near the ceiling. In one room I must carry it to reach but the vacuum is so light I don't mind. Maybe I can get extra hose. This would be a great vaccuum for the elderly.
customer_reviews.author: Biscotti1000

customer_reviews.title: Not worth price-threw out after 3rd use...
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Motor burned out third time using it. Might be ok for very light duty, but seemed flimsy and skidded around instead of rolling.
customer_reviews.author: MelCurr

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum for the money
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum is great. Setup and usage is simple and the vacuum delivers a lot of suction power. That said, the vacuum head extension is badly designed. It cannot handle the suction power and will get stuck on carpets unless you decrease power. This is alleviated by only raking in as you vacuum (instead of raking and pushing). A minor annoyance, but it beats having a vacuum without suction power, which is what it's replacing.
customer_reviews.author: E. Cham

customer_reviews.title: Budget Friendly Canister Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power for a small cheap canister vacuum... for the first year. But gradually lost its power. We've had it for around 2 yrs now, using it as our main vacuum for hardwood floors. We've changed the bags and replaced or cleaned the filters as necessary, but the sucking power of this vacuum has severely dwindled over time for no apparent reason. However, upon comparing similar vacuums, priced 3X as much this one, we may end up buying another of this kind and replacing it again in 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: germericankids

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It has good suction--better than I ever expected. I have bare wood floors and will find a cordless stick vac for them--as I am 86 and this little purple guy is a little difficult for me to manage the cords and hose in the dining with all the chairs and through doors in my 6 room, 2 bath condo, I will use it a lot for 6 months in the open basement of my lake house. The big old shop vac was a bear to move around. This little guy swivels on a dime. There are not a lot of a chair legs to deal with . The automatic cord retrieval is also a real plus.
customer_reviews.author: nancy Tarr

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum cleaner sucks. No
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum cleaner sucks. No, that's a good thing. Because it's a vacuum cleaner, and it's supposed to suck; and this one does, and very well, too. I was afraid it would scare the cat, but she just yawned and watched it with mild disinterest. So as a cat-scaring device: not so good. As a device to suck up cat hair and other detritus? Excellent. Versatile, not too heavy to carry, worked nicely on the sofa (after I moved the cat); would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S.

customer_reviews.title: great little vacuum for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small light weight vacuum for my house which is on the smaller size. we have all hard floors so it works great. I'm not sure how well it would do for cleaning a carpet, but it works great for what i need. The fact that its light weight is great to take it up and downs stairs. Suction seems to be pretty good and you can even adjust the suction power which is handy in some situations. I would say its a good vacuum for the price.
customer_reviews.author: H. Long

customer_reviews.title: Strong Sucking
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has very strong sucking, especially for hair. I used it in kitchen and hard wood floor and carpet. The only thing it needs to improve is the wheel is too small. it is not easy to push on carpet. Many people complaint that the connection fell off. it did not happened to mine.
customer_reviews.author: cherry 95

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks in a good way!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum really sucks! And in a good way. Lots of power and lightweight. I bought this for our RV and I like the compact design. The wand telescopes so it does not take up a lot of room. The only improvement I would make is better attachments. I had a floor attachment from a Sears vacuum that I use instead of the one that was provided. With that said, this is a bargain at under $50. Update: Like it so much, I bought one for the house to use in our craft room. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Smith

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It is easy to move around and really helpful for spot cleanup, especially kitty hair. I love them, but they are fuzzy and it is shedding season. I have an Oreck upright which I use for weekly vacuuming, but this fits the bill for in between or for heavy duty suctioning power: Do not get the nozzle close to anything you don't want sucked up, including toes or kitties. It is also great for upholstery and the bed to ensure those icky mites are gone. Would highly recommend. BTW cord rewind works perfectly. Only negative is that bags are so small, but several come with and more can be ordered on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Aset

customer_reviews.title: For a cheap vacuum, does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need anything fancy, or don't have a lot of carpets, this is a great little vacuum. It's not fancy, but the suction is good. We keep it on the screen porch with the litter boxes, to clean up scattered litter. It's not sufficient for actual carpet and too bulky and awkward to store in the closet (takes up too much room because hose doesn't attach to the canister for storage) to use in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Overall, Good
customer_reviews.text: This heavy duty (heavy being the operative word) vacuum does a wonderful job of picking up even the smallest residue off the floor, wood or carpet. The only issue I have is that it is heavy, at least for me. I travel several months in an RV so wanted something small but effective. It is effective and small but still has enough bulk and extensions to make storage in an RV a challenge. For the money and the suction, it is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: I. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Works Beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Why do I love this wonderful little vacuum? Because it is So Easy to Pull around. It has a long cord. I’ve used it many times and still doesn’t demand a new bag. Still has great suction power too! I’m older, drug around a heavy vacuum for most of my life. This one makes housekeeping easy peasy. Love.
customer_reviews.author: Shug

customer_reviews.title: Good for Hard floors but not carpets and rugs
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews on here, I was very optimistic about this vacuum, however, I haven't been 100 percent pleased. Pros: light-weight, vacuums hard floors well, low priced Cons: so light that it turns over a lot, doesn't pickup hair from rugs/carpet well at all- I would only recommend this vacuum if you have only hard floors. I will need to get another vacuum for my carpets and rugs.
customer_reviews.author: April G

customer_reviews.title: Its not even too bad on the carpet stairs
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is bomb for cleaning hardwood floors, the kitchen linoleum, welcome mats, everything. Its not even too bad on the carpet stairs, even without a beater brush. You do have to pass a few more times on anything carpet, and work it a little harder, but I have two vacuums for this purpose. One for upstairs carpet, one for downstairs smooth floors, at the price point its hard not to justify having one for each purpose. In brush mode it grabs everything. If I have pet hair the front brush on the main attachment has to get de-haired once in awhile during cleaning so that it doesnt get clogged, but beyond that it works great. Never lost suction.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Moceri

customer_reviews.title: she tried it and said it worked great so I"m happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it might replace my aging Panasonic full size vacuum. when it arrived I found it's rather small so I gave it to my niece who just got her own apartment, she tried it and said it worked great so I"m happy. I did not put it through my own testing which would have been extensive and I have a large apartment with varying vacuuming needs in different rooms. I don't think the rug attachment has a power brush so that would be a minus for me, but I might have used it for small cleanups or in the basement or cleaning the car. It never hurts to have a spare vacuum. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jeffer03

customer_reviews.title: powerful suction but cheap hose and accessories
customer_reviews.text: Great suction for a small vacuum. Lightweight and easy to carry. Retracting cord is a plus. Telescoping wand is a plus. Cheap hose that is stiff and not long enough. Attachments are almost useless and made of thin plastic. I will be buying a fitting to convert my old Hoover attachments. Bissell should have made the attachments better and charged an additional ten bucks. Overall, still worth the money because of the suction.
customer_reviews.author: RDM

customer_reviews.title: NOT as claimed...  Beware of the reviews.
customer_reviews.text: This is Rubbish. I purchased this vacuum based on diligent comparison with other vacuums in order to find one that could pick up pet hair off of low level, smooth carpet and hard floors. However, the only way I can get it to pick up pet hair is to use a rubber rake to pile it up and THEN use the vacuum to suck up the pile. Yet It still does NOT pick up everything. Huge disappointment after going through so many careful steps to purchase a good product. Shortly after receiving the vacuum, news came out about so many fake or "paid for" reviews on Amazon. Save your time -- get something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Benham

customer_reviews.title: Wand is junk.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely use the extension wand because I use the vacuum mainly for furniture and carpeted steps. Today when I used it to go around the baseboards it fell apart. The plastic piece that you use to extend and retract the inner wand completely fell apart. I really expected better than that from a Bissell product. The wand is now junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: karen Mcclain

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I used one while staying at a friend's house and loved it so I bought one. I have a lot of long hair and hardwood floors, this little guy works amazing at picking up all my hair and all the dust. I use it almost every day, I love that its lightweight and easy to tuck away. I would definitely buy it again or recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Maritza Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price , loving it !
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. I love canister vacuums and I needed one for myself and my daughter. Powerful suction, good attachments. I wouldn’t rely on this as my only vacuum if I had a large home or lots of carpet, best for wood or ceramic type flooring. These were refurbished and 1 of them arrived without extra bags or attachments. I was given a discount when I complained. Packaging was not great.
customer_reviews.author: evelyn markarian

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little maroon vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum exceeded my expectations. It’s pretty darn powerful for the price and size. I’ve had this for two weeks and I use it every other day for dog hair and general household dirt. It seems good quality and is very lightweight. It’s not too loud. It switches from area rugs to hard wood easily. The cord is a very nice long length. I can do a whole room and the hallway easily without relocating the plug in. The refill bags are pretty inexpensive. I found a pack of 8 for $8. That works for me. On top of everything, it’s very cute in maroon!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Landers

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't suck because it sucks!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best vacuum I've ever owned. It fits under furniture where bagless and/or upright vacuums will not. It's surprisingly lightweight and powerful. I thought I would never use the adjustable suction control knob but it actually comes in useful for cleaning small rugs and bathmats. The design is simple and accessories are useful. Changing out the bag is easy and clean. No more shaking dust all over the room trying to get the hair clogs out of the canister as with bagless vacuums, This thing works and works well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Yoshida

customer_reviews.title: This WAS great while.............
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in April and it quit working in September after having it only 6 months. While it worked, I loved that I could move it about so easy. I used to vacuum out cabinets and drawers. Very disappointing expected a lot better from Bissell.
customer_reviews.author: River

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to assemble, great suction on hard floors. Tried to suck up the bathroom rug, lol. I use an upright on my carpets but this did a fair job on them as well. Not sure how anyone could have trouble with this unless you abused it somehow! I am a young senior and appreciate the light weight of this vac. Will work great to clean out my car, too. Update- I put my upright in the garage and use this exclusively. You could not buy it from me or take it away from me now...I love it. Light and easy for big or small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Not a Vine member

customer_reviews.title: FRUSTATED WITH THE FILTER
customer_reviews.text: I got this vacuum 3 years ago. I have been trying to remove the pre-motor filter but not able to. On the booklet it says that in order to remove the filter . I need to remove first the clip located in the center of the pre motor filter. I called Bissell and spoke to a technician in there ask him to tell me how to remove the clip from the filter but he didn't know. He transfer me to another guy and he couldn't help me either. I'm very frustrated as I see the filter really dirty but I am afraid that if I keep trying the filter will rip.
customer_reviews.author: 1thruthful

customer_reviews.title: Great value and a light vacuum that does a big vacuum job.
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum really surprised me. It's fantastic. Compact, LOVE the retractable power cord, and it seriously does what it's supposed to ... vacuum up stuff. The hose and wand are sturdy and feel like a more expensive product. This little sucker (pardon the pun) really does the job. I live in a home with all tile, a large dog and some kitty cats, so between dog hair, dog treat crumbs, and tracked about kitty litter, not to mention the occasional attack on a nasty insect, it does it all and does it well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G. Sapino

customer_reviews.title: the cost of each of the two times I vacuumed before it broke was $24.50.
customer_reviews.text: No rotating brush and low vacuum, makes the job an exhausting and frustrating task. I used it couple of times and then as soos as the vacuum cleaner was plug into a outlet. It would trip the circuit breaker for that outlet. This would happen in every outlet around the house. My guess is that the vacuum cleaner has an internal short circuit that rendered the cleaner useless after a month and a half after the original date of purchace. Just in time not to be able to return it to amazon. Making the cost of each of the two times I vacuumed $ 24.50 each. Very expensive indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Rafa

customer_reviews.title: Best Canister Vacuum I've Ever Used!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I purchased this product in May of 2014 - Im writing this review in October of 2018 - the vacuum is still in excellent condition and is one of the best Ive ever used. I owned a residential cleaning business from 2010 to 2014 - so I purchased about 5 different canister vacuums in that time period. This is the only one still working and in great shape! It is very versatile and easy to store too. Works on carpet and hardwood. Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.author: CajunQuilter62

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I need this for my apartment. So far (it's October 2016... bought this last Spring?), so good. Things don't get trapped easily, and I love that I can change the bag. I wanted a "bag" vacuum cleaner to keep things really clean and trap dust and fine particles due to my allergies. Several vacuum bags come with your initial purchase of the vacuum cleaner. I have only changed bags ONCE so far. I moved in July and did a ton of vacuuming. Even then, it still wasn't completely full and I probably could have gotten away with keeping that same one for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Erika

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I love this little vacuum! it tried to suck my straw rugs up off the floor the first time I used it; that's always a good sign. It's so lightweight that it's easy to carry down to the garage and vacuum my car too. Who needs a fancy-pants Dyson when this little $50 machine does such a great job?!?! It's good on my bare wood floors and on my rugs, also good in corners and on windowsills. It was a score.
customer_reviews.author: MaryWho

customer_reviews.title: I didn't want to always have to carry it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a horrible Dyson small canister vacuum. One of the (many) things I disliked about the Dyson was the design, which had wheels at the bottom so you could pull it, but the canister flipped on its side as you moved across the floor. You dragged the canister behind you, sometimes upside down, because it wouldn't stay upright, ever. So I chose this one because its low/wide design, good for pulling. Other than that it works so far. It was easy to put together. Better than the Dyson, which cost about four times as much. So, I'm happy..
customer_reviews.author: Caroline W.

customer_reviews.title: For the price you can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum is pretty awesome if you have a small apartment like me with two cats and a dog. The suction is strong and the bags are way easier to deal with than a bagless vacuum. It's relatively quiet for a vacuum which again, is great for an apartment. Sure, the attachments are a little cheaply made but they'll get the job done and like I said, for the price you can't beat it. I would definitely recommend this vacuum for pet owners and for apartment living.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf Baggins

customer_reviews.title: The lid won't stay latched
customer_reviews.text: It seems my latch is defective and it pops open all the time. It is a very small lip where the latch catches and the latch doesn't seem to want go over it easily. The suction is great when it does work. I will try it for a bit but I think it is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Omadna

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Suction leaves a lot to be desired. Cord is very short. You have to vacuum one room at a time and move the plug between rooms. I really wish I could find a vacuum for hard wood floors that is reasonably priced but has a lot of suction, especially for pet hair. Am already looking for a new vacuum and will probably give this away to one of my kids as it would be great for a small apartment without pets; but for me, I have 2 dogs and 3 cats and I vacuum every day so I need something more sturdy and strong.
customer_reviews.author: MissPriss1016

customer_reviews.title: Heck of a little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought princess vacuums and kirby's in the past and I was so wasting my money! This little cannister is really powerful and does a terrific job. I know many complain that the attachments are made of cheap plastic, but considering the price of the vacuum, how can anyone complain. And yes, the metal extension bars are slightly shorter than most vacuums but I'm 5'4" and it works fine for me. The good news is, other vacuum parts would universally fit this machine so another bar extensor or attachments could be used if these would be issues for you. All in all, probably one of the best deals for a powerful little vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen R.

customer_reviews.title: This is Great!!!  I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I don't dislike anything about this vacuum. I absolutely love this. I have a very large house and this vacuum takes care of every room in my house. I am getting ready to order more bags. I hope Amazon has them. It is light weight. I can hold it with one hand and use the other hand to vacuum my staircase which has 15 steps. The suction is very powerful. You can adjust it on the vacuum and also on the rod. You won't be sorry with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Oma Ruth17

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum for under $200
customer_reviews.text: The price made me a little nervous ordering it, but my sister has had this vacuum for over two years and loves it. It came in second place on a Good Mythical Morning episode where they tested different vacuums, which made me want to buy it. I love it! It does well with all types of floors, especially on carpet and stairs. It has different attachments to clean in corners and the handle reaches high up to get the ceilings. Best vacuum I’ve ever bought, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not so comfortable. My main complaint is that within a few ...
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum cleans well. For tall people--six feet or so--the handle is a bit short even when extended the maximum length, causing you to have to lean forward while vacuuming. Not so comfortable. My main complaint is that within a few weeks the cord stopped retracting smoothly or fully; if it altogether fails to retract over time, storage of the vacuum will become an issue.
customer_reviews.author: M. J Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for wooden flooring. Worked great on our carpet as well. I purchased it knowing we would be restoring our hardwood floors. It's small, not expensive, works very well, easy to operate, wonderfully easy to change bags, and easy to store. I am tall so I do have to bend over a bit to use it but it's just what we need. Our house is small and we don't have much storage room available. I'm so pleased with the functionality and pricing. Super happy and would recommend highly for wooden flooring definitely or for a small apartment or small house with carpet. Especially for those on a budget. Thrilled! Fantastic vacuum!!!!!! Best kept secret ever! Buy one NOW!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Bybee Babcock

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this Zing vacuum!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly powerful little vacuum cleaner. I love using it and it really does a great job on hardwoods. I have two little dogs that shed constantly and this vacuum did a marvelous job by baseboards and in corners. This is so much better to me than the 3 $digit wind tunnel vacuum I had. Using that thing was like being in vacuum hell for me: it was a heavy, clunky, hard to maneuver horrendous piece of machinery that has since been donated to charity. This new "zing" is lightweight, but powerful. I will never go with a bagless vacuum again..........bags do a better job. Happy happy happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TPA

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it's lightweight and looked promising on the website - and am ready to replace my household vacuum. But when I tried it (briefly) on the carpet the suction seemed ok (in fairness I may not installed the attachment properly) I then used it to clean out the car - and this scenario it worked great. Overall It's a good price and a good little alternate vacuum. But prob. not intended for more heavy-duty household carpets, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use for my wood floor and to use the extra tools for dusting. I am very impressed with the power of this little vacuum and it doesn't lose the suction power even after weeks of using it. It is easy to maneuver around furniture and underneath. The only small complaint is the length of the cord but that is easily remedied with an extension cord. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: BJG

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is great. Lightweight, easy to use, and reliable. I have hardwood floors and got tired of sweeping all the time and bought this to take place of sweeping. I have zero complaints about it and I have had it for several months and have used it A LOT.
customer_reviews.author: Jolie Turk

customer_reviews.title: One Year Old..Doing Great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a rental cabin in the Smokies that we personally clean...I'm VERY particular about keeping it spotless...and this liitle whiz bang vacuum does an excellent job! Easy to clean under beds and dressers, too. Mind you, most of our floors are wood and what rugs we have are low pile...not sure how well it would do on carpet or thicker rugs. But we really love it!
customer_reviews.author: Janice McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Little Dirt Monster
customer_reviews.text: This is my little friend since 2016. He's been trough a lot ! I can only recommend this vacuum. Lot's of pet hair. Renovations. Really dirty messes. He never gave up ! I'm going to buy a new one soon.
customer_reviews.author: sabine goudeau

customer_reviews.title: works well for its size
customer_reviews.text: this is a nice little light vacuum cleaner. It was easy to move it about. It is not a powerful machine but it does get the job done. I am disappointed with the attachments. They are really tiny and didn't do the job well especially the crevice and brush attachment which is one attachment. The floor attachment was coming off the hose a lot, it could have been me not putting it in tight enough. It is a good vacuum for the price I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: R. Y. Tan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum!! The suction power is great and works well on both carpets and hard floors. I love that the wand part is adjustable and the power cord is retractable. It came with several bags and attachments. There's a little gauge on the top that shows when the bag is getting full too. My only complaints would be that it's a little heavy carrying it up and down the stairs (not terrible though) and that the cord is on the shorter side. The value you get for your money though, is definitely worth it! I highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Strand

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks...in the best possible way!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I SHOULDN'T get excited about a vacuum. It's just a vacuum, right? I have a German Shepherd rescue that has rocked my world. Hair EVERYWHERE. I have tried a dust mop, Roomba, crying. All of it helped a little bit, but until I got the Zing I never got on top of the hair. This little vacuum is easy to work with and has a ton of suction. Very cool that it has an adjustable suction knob. The retractable cord is a nice feature as well. I am amazed this vacuum is this cheap. It does so much for so little.
customer_reviews.author: SteveInSac

customer_reviews.title: It sucks-- WONDERFULLY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two-- the price was GREAT!!! This little thing is a mighty mite!! I use one of them on my balcony -- it sucks up dried leaves and other detritus and asks for more. Powerful suction. Plenty of attachments -- BUT I DO regarding that little black plastic band that covers the hole just above the place where the hose attaches-- I wish it was tighter-- I had to use rubber bands to keep it from sliding up ALL TOO OFTEN, and interrupting the suction effect.
customer_reviews.author: BookAce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent suction, attachments poor.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has excellent suction but all accessories are too small to be convenient. I am 5'6" but the stick part makes you bend over to use. The attachment that does the floor or carpet is way too small. It is easy to remove though to do spot cleaning. The upholstery attachment is a joke, unusable. But it works, eats dirt, inexpensive and ok for an extra. It's best for floors, not so good on carpets
customer_reviews.author: a critic

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and even WORSE customer service
customer_reviews.text: Buy another brand. The price is NOT worth the headache. The plastic lever at the top of the extension arm/handle just fell off after 18 months of 1-3 times use per month. I contacted Bissell via text, phone, and chat. A theme of delayed response and inaction ensued. They made countless excuses. They asked for one tiny detail at a time. They are in the Philippines. Buy something else. The machine will work for the 12 month warranty, then you are screwed!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. TMT

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I really love this thing. It's super simple to set up right out of the box, and it has some amazing suction power. I mean it feels like it literally can get stuck to our laminate floors if left stationary and on full blast, which I think is great to really pull all the little debris/dust out. It's really simple and easy to use and it is conveniently small and lightweight that make it easy to carry and store. It also comes with an extra bag. I'm happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars -- For a studio apartment
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to avoid the complications of a cheap bagless model and get a low-cost bagged canister. I live in a studio apartment with low-rise carpet and a dog. It's light, it got great suction, and the attachments serve functions for cleaning small things (like jackets or windowsills). Doing your whole house with this would be time-consuming but effective, if you're looking to tackle a room or two, it's a solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vacuum as we just had new Vinyl Plank Flooring installed and I wanted something that would work well on flat surfaces. This vacuum is a huge disappointment. The canister seems sturdy enough, but the attachments leave much to be desired. After trying 3 times to use it, I just gave up and will go back to my old electolux. I can order a replacement hose for a but more than I paid for this replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Bissell Zing Bagged Canister Vacuum, Maroon, 4122 - Corded,Maroon Bagged
product_meta.description: Color:Maroon Bagged| Style:Zing CanisterZing Bagged Canister Vacuum, 4122 by BISSELL Canister Vacuum Cleaners BISSELL canister vacuums are light and easy to maneuver. They’re great for stairs and other surfaces like curtains, upholstery, auto interiors, and more. What are the benefits to cleaning with the BISSELL Zing Bagged Canister Vacuum? BISSELL Zing bagged canister vacuum makes any cleaning task seem effortless. The lightweight design and carry handle provide portable convenience. The Multi-Surface Floor Nozzle allows for easy cleaning of carpet, rugs and bare floors. The telescoping wand allows you to comfortably maneuver around and under furniture and also clean hard to reach areas like drapes and ceilings. When you are finished, the cord will automatically rewind with the push of a button. What is the difference between an upright vacuum and a canister vacuum? Canister vacuums are low to the ground vacuums that have a long hose with a wand on the end. As you clean through the hose and wand, you pull the canister unit behind you. Upright vacuums stand tall and have a handle, which is used to push the vacuum. When cleaning carpets, the debris is removed through the foot or base of the unit. Most uprights also have a hose and on-board tools, which are typically used for hard to reach places and when cleaning furniture. At one time, canisters were thought to be easier to use for cleaning hard to reach places and for cleaning a larger variety of floors surfaces. However, the uprights of today have added cleaning features, such as bare floor height adjustments, brush roll on/off switches, and are easily maneuverable. In addition, the on board cleaning tools have made upright vacuums even more versatile. Although uprights are easier to use and more effective at cleaning larger areas in the home, they can still be a challenge when cleaning stairs. Which type of vacuum is better -- bag less or bagged? Neither type of vacuum is “better” than the other. A bagged vacuum will lose its cleaning effectiveness as the bag fills with debris. The bag must be changed when it is about 1/2 to 2/3 full for the best cleaning performance. The choice between a bagged and bag less vacuum really depends on your personal preference. Portable, Multi-Surface Cleaning! Powerful suction gets the dirt high and low--great for bare floors, rugs and above-floor cleaning Easily go from cleaning carpets to hard floors with the flip of a switch Automatic cord rewind for quick cord storage with the push of a button. Buying this product saves pets. BISSELL proudly supports BISSELL Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets. When you buy a BISSELL product, you help save pets, too. We’re proud to design products that help make pet messes, odors and pet homelessness disappear.
feature_bullets: Every BISSELL purchase helps save pets. BISSELL proudly supports BISSELL Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets.
Dirt cup capacity - 2 liters bag capacity. Portable, Multi-Surface Cleaning
Powerful suction gets the dirt high and low--great for bare floors, rugs and above-floor cleaning
Easily go from cleaning carpets to hard floors with the flip of a switch
Automatic cord rewind for quick cord storage with the push of a button
Includes telescoping Wand, Automatic Cord Rewind, Variable Suction Control, Full Bag Indicator

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,033 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Variable Suction Control, Bissell Zing Bagged Canister Vacuum, Full Bag Indicator, Automatic Cord Rewind, Telescoping Wand
